meanings.definition: Having a pinkish-yellow color like a peach.
meanings.sent1: The sunset painted the sky a peachier hue.
meanings.sent2: Her dress was peachier than the flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent3: The peachier walls made the room feel warm and cozy.
meanings.sent4: The peachier tones of the painting added a soft glow to the room.
meanings.sent5: The peachier shade of lipstick brightened her whole face.

meanings.definition: More attractive or pleasant than before.
meanings.sent1: The garden looked even peachier after the rain.
meanings.sent2: The peachier smile on her face showed her happiness.
meanings.sent3: The peachier cupcakes were a hit at the party.
meanings.sent4: The peachier view from the top of the hill took his breath away.
meanings.sent5: The peachier aroma of the flowers filled the room with joy.

meanings.definition: To become more cheerful or lively.
meanings.sent1: After the good news, she peachiered up and started dancing.
meanings.sent2: The music made everyone peachier and ready to celebrate.
meanings.sent3: He tried to peachier up the gloomy atmosphere with jokes.
meanings.sent4: The sunshine seemed to peachier up the whole town.
meanings.sent5: Her positive attitude always peachiered up the room.
